name: Club Quarters Chicago -- Wacker at Michigan

reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights in a studio suite. Excellent location, lovely clean rooms and excellent service.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: This was a great hotel! Parking wasn't a bad price and the room was big. I made sure to get one of the bigger rooms when booking because I was traveling with a one year old. I booked the one room suite with kitchenette. It had a king bed and a pull out couch. The kitchenette had a stove top, a toaster, a microwave, a fridge, and dishes! Perfect when traveling with a young one.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 days for business. The room was SO small. It was fine with me for my limited stay in the actual room, but you had to move the desk chair to open the bathroom door! The room was clean, but there is no way you could have more than 1 person in there. The 2nd floor has a “living room” and I am sure that is for the claustrophobic people who had to get out of their small room. The living room has a lot of book and magazines. The lobby is also very inviting and relaxing.
reviews.title: Good for just a bed and desk

reviews.text: Nearby is EVERYTHING you would want – shopping, restaurants, you name it. Very easy to get a taxi or get to busses, etc.
reviews.title: Nice, if small hotel in a beautiful location

reviews.text: Great for business traveler – definitely not for families!
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. It is an excellent location just across the river from the much more expensive mega hotels. This smaller boutique hotel has smallish rooms and is merely a nicely furnished, liveable scale place. It has the advantage of being near breakfast shops and convenience stores but also close to the Trump Hotel and Sheraton, Hyatt and Hilton for the conventions that regularly use Chicago's Magnificent Mile neighborhood shopping and energy for clients and convention parties. This small hotel is built in an older office building. Rooms are in the heart of Chicago and close to everything. The check in was fast and efficient, check out was great and service was handled well. Overall, great value and highly professional stay for business or leisure on a getaway. Go elsewhere if you want more space or better views, or have ideas of a vacation for coupes or kids. This is a fine place for a quick visit or simple business. great meeting rooms and internet access with printing and conference facilities. Great value and superb location.
reviews.title: Nice Location/ Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at this hotel in JUne 2011. It was the best location ever! I keep recommeding it to everyone. I did not find the rooms that small as i've seen posted. The hotel staff were very curtious and friendly and willing to help with anything. Especially Wells!The room was very clean. You can walk to everything if you don't want to, there are cabs right outside. The loop trains are very efficient and clean as well We were quite impressed with how clean the city was and recommend it to everyone! We will be back, and i would love to stay at club quarters wacker and michigan!
reviews.title: WE LOVED IT AND WILL BE BACK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: The room I had at Club Quarters on Wacker might not have been as big as all outdoors, but it was more than satisfactory. It was cozy, but definitley not claustrophobic. Very clean, very quiet, and the location was excellent - right across the street from the Chicago Architectural Foundation's boat tour of Chicago buildings. I was quite happy with the rate I got (I booked in March), and it compared more than favorably with other hotels in the area. I'd happily stay there again.
reviews.title: Very nice Chicago hotel

reviews.text: The location is perfect for business and sight-seeing. The rooms are small, which I expected. The price was cheap, so I really have nothing to complain about. The restaurant off the lobby is good, reasonably priced and the service is great. All of the staff in the restaurant are very friendly.
reviews.title: Great location, small rooms, so so service

reviews.text: The hotel is very tall and narrow. That means that with only two elevators you can sometimes wait for a very long time and then have the elevator doors open to find there is no room. It was not unusual for the wait to be 5 to 10 minutes. The worst part of this stay was trying to retrieve the luggage I stored on my last day. It took 25 minutes for them to bring it out and by then I was worried about getting to the airport on time. When that's the last impression you get of a hotel, you're not likely to return to the same hotel.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: I'm a medical professional and I was attending a conference being held in the Hyatt Regency and wanted a cheap sleep within an easy walk and this place fit the bill. It's maybe a 3 minute walk to the Hyatt where my conference was being held.
reviews.title: OK Place To Stay Inexpensively In The Loop

reviews.text: This was my first stay at a Club Quarters hotel which apparently is a chain of like 14 value-oriented hotels in big cities catering to the business crowd.
reviews.title: They are in the business of taking care of people!

reviews.text: Anyone can stay at a Club Quarters, but their marketing gimmick is that if you're a member of an affiliated organization, you get a cheaper rate. It turns out, I'm a member of one of their affiliated organizations but was unable to get the cheaper rate either on-line, via phone when I made my reservation, or in person when I showed up. There were different excuses as to why I couldn't make reservations at the affiliated member rate, but I think the 'cheap rate for members' might be more marketing fluff than any real savings. Nevertheless, at ~$130/night + 15% taxes it was a far sight cheaper than the Hyatt.
reviews.title: Decent place. Service can be improved

reviews.text: The place is right across from Trump Tower and is close to everything in the loop. Scores or restaurants are within easy walking distance. You couldn't ask for a better location.
reviews.title: Phenomenal customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building is a high-rise, and the first 10 floors or so are offices or condos I think, with the hotel above that, and they put me on the 38th floor, which I think is the highest floor for regular hotel use. Despite the height, the view wasn't that good since other high rises pretty much surround this building blocking most of the view. I was facing South and could see a small amount of distant South Chicago like McCormick place and the South lakeshore.
reviews.title: Great central location for 1st time visit!

reviews.text: This was a nice place with a great location. It was easy to use the train and bus to get there and get around the city. It is also very close to the water taxi. If you are looking for a room for 3, don't trust the web site. We booked a suite online and when we got there the room we had reserved did not accommodate 3 adults. The staff were friendly and helpful so within 5 minutes we had a different room that worked out fine. If you get a room on the 2 floors - in the tower - you will have to use stairs for the last flight or two. But I was told the view is worth it. Skip the restaurant that is in the hotel- the food was awful.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is at a very convenient place, price is very good for the area, and very reasonable parking (for Chicago). However, the room was very small and hotel did not seem serviced well. We asked for extra pillows, they only had one in the whole hotel (they claimed). We called to tell them that toilet was turning on and off, but they did not have anyone to fix it at night (OK, I guess). We went to bed early, exhausted from travel and sightseeing on hot day. I woke up at 1:30 a.m. to bright message light on phone blinking -- bit of panic but when I checked the message, it had been posted at 10:40 p.m. about what to do if we wanted to check bags the next day (we did not). If I could not find another place, I would stay again, but I think I will try other places first.
reviews.title: great location, not great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. The hotel is located right on the river at the south end of the Magnificent Mile. We had a view of the river (and the memorial day parade staging!). The room is small and somewhat business-traveler oriented: desk with pull out laptop stand. In our room there was a "king" bed composed of two twin mattresses, and a standing shower rather than a tub. The room has a coffee maker, but there is also free coffee and tea (and fruit, allegedly) in the club room on the second floor. In the hallway there is a distilled water cooler with some pre-sealed empty plastic water bottles that are complimentary.
reviews.title: Great location, good value, no nonsense.

reviews.text: The hotel itself shares space with "River Hotel", with Club Quarters having the upper floors in the highrise. There is an italian restaurant on the ground floor although we did not eat there (there are dozens of other restaurants a few minutes' walk from the hotel.)
reviews.title: Location Location Location ! !

reviews.text: I do have a few reservations: on one occasion our room smelled faintly of smoke at night (we do not smoke, but evidently some of the hotel's other guests do). More seriously, during a heavy rain the hotel's elevator went out of service due to dripping water and we were forced to take the stairs up and down from the 15th floor. However the elevator issue was resolved by the time we had returned to the hotel later in the evening.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in every aspect

aka: Club Quarters Chicago -- Wacker At Michigan Hotel Chicago
description: The Club Quarters Chicago -- Wacker at Michigan is a superbly located hotel, which resides in the legendary Mather Tower. Built in 1928, the hotel features state-of-the-art amenities and attentive, but never overbearing, service. Just one block from the world-famous Magnificent Mile and steps from the Chicago River, guests will delight in the fact that the hotel is characteristically Chicago yet uncharacteristically priced. We look forward to your visit!
